intro: Selago laxiflora, commonly known as the slender leaf selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are thin and elongated, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Selago laxiflora is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and delicate blooms.
